We are so deeply saddened by the loss of Phillip Perry, principal of G.W. Carver Middle School and a beloved member of the Waco ISD family and community. Our heartfelt condolences go out to his family, friends, staff and students during an unimaginable time.

Mr. Perry has been a role model to countless students in our district and in his neighborhood. He cared deeply for his students and colleagues at G.W. Carver Middle School, providing guidance and support at any time. In addition to serving as principal at Carver, Mr. Perry often umpired local baseball games and refereed basketball games, offering words of encouragement to young athletes.

During this difficult time of mourning, we encourage you to share your stories and memories of Mr. Perry.

Waco ISD is thrilled to announce our February Employees of the Month!

Paul Watkins, lead custodian at Parkdale Elementary School, was selected because he goes "above and way beyond" to help teachers, administration and students. He is a "positive and proactive dynamo" who greets every staff member and student with a smile and an encouraging word.

We just wrapped up another enlightening Design Thinking training where our school leaders, teachers, students and community members have engaged in a creative problem solving program. A big thank you to Dr. Julie Schell and Tamie Glass of the The University of Texas at Austin School of Design & Creative Technologies, who also facilitated a successful round of training for WISD in December.

The YMCA OF CENTRAL TEXAS, Junior League of Waco, Waco ISD Education Foundation and Waco Rotary Club have partnered together to distribute a personalized book to every kindergarten, first and second grade student at each elementary campus in the district. The books, featuring each student as the main character of his or her story, address some excellent topics such as using good manners, not giving up and telling the truth.

Yesterday, representatives from each organization kicked off the project and delivered books to students at Crestview Elementary School. They surprised each student and then took some time to read a few of their brand new books featuring, none other than, themselves. The hope is that students will get excited about reading at home with their family members.

Many thanks to the YMCA of Central Texas, Junior League of Waco, Waco ISD Education Foundation and the Waco Rotary Club for providing our students with such an educational keepsake!

Cedar Ridge staff and students donned their spirit wear in green and gold to celebrate Baylor's Homecoming this weekend. Thank you to the staff and student athletes who made this unique experience possible!
